alert.note: Alert for Medina (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 5:33PM EDT until June 01 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Cuyahoga, Medina and Summit. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 532 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Multiple rounds of thunderstorms are expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Parma, Cuyahoga Falls, North Royalton, Kent, Solon, Hudson, Twinsburg, Streetsboro, Macedonia, Stow, Parma Heights, Broadview Heights, Aurora, Brecksville, Seven Hills, Hinckley, Independence, Northfield, Richfield and Reminderville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
